name: Baseball for Dummies #23 Quiz | Baseball | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following was a Los Angeles Dodger?
questions.explanation:
Sandy Koufax.

	Koufax either set or broke many league pitching records in his career.  He was forced to retire in 1966 due to arthritis.

questions.text: Which of the following teams did Reggie Jackson never play for?
questions.explanation:
San Diego Padres.

	'Mr. October' never wore a Padre uniform.  Reggie played one season for the Orioles in 1976, where he hit 27 home runs in the season.

questions.text: Which player had the nickname, "Stan the Man"?
questions.explanation:
Stan Musial.

	Stan Musial played his entire career with the Cardinals from 1941-1963.  He missed the 1945 season due to war obligations.  He smacked 475 home runs for St.Louis throughout his career.  He also pitched in one game in his career in 1952, but went no-decision.

questions.text: Which of the following players have never pitched in a Major League game?
questions.explanation:
Reggie Jackson.

	Cobb pitched 2 games in 1918, and one game for the Tigers in 1925.  Grace pitched one inning for Arizona in 2002 (and allowed a home run), and 'Stan the Man' pitched in one game for the Cardinals in 1952.

questions.text: What is it called when a batter hits a home run with the bases loaded?
questions.explanation:
Grand Slam.

	The famous four-bagger, or Grand Slam, is one of the largest fan favorites.  The batter is credited with 4 RBIs.

questions.text: Who won the 1960 World Series, which saw Bill Mazeroski hit a bottom of the ninth inning Series-winning home run?
questions.explanation:
Pittsburgh.

	For the first time in baseball history, the 'Maz' won a World Series by ending the Series in a game-winning home run.  The Pirates beat the Yankees 4 games to 3, but not before the Yankees'  3 wins came by the scores of 16-3, 10-0, and 12-0.  The Angels and Houston did not exist in 1960.

questions.text: How many times in the 20th century, did a player hit 30 or more triples in a season?
questions.explanation:
1.

	John Owen 'Chief' Wilson played 9 seasons of baseball with Pittsburgh and St.Louis.  In 1912, he set a record of hitting 36 triples in a season with the Pirates.  Ironically, this speedster never stole more than 17 bases in a season.  Only 3 players in the 20th century hit 26 triples in a season, to be the runner-ups.

questions.text: 'Shoeless' Joe Jackson 'retired' from baseball with which team?
questions.explanation:
Chicago White Sox.

	Jackson was a member of the Black Sox scandal in 1919, which allegedly fixed a World Series against the Cincinnati Reds, in which the Reds won the Series 5 games to 3.  His final season of baseball was in 1920.  The other teams listed, did not exist until at least 40 years later.

questions.text: Before the name 'Detroit Tigers', what was their original name in their franchise history?
questions.explanation:
They were always the Tigers.

	The Tigers were always the Tigers.  Their franchise began in 1901, along with many other teams in the Major Leagues.  After numerous American League pennants, the Tigers won their first World Series in 1935 against the Cubs of Chicago.  Mickey Cochrane played the role of catcher and manager for the team, which rostered the likes of Hank Greenberg, Goose Goslin, and the pitching arms of Schoolboy Rowe and Tommy Bridges.

questions.text: Which of the following players won a season MVP Award in both the American and National League?
questions.explanation:
Frank Robinson.

	All the players except Robinson played their entire career with one team.  Frank won his first MVP in 1961 with the Cincinnati Reds, then again with the Orioles of Baltimore in 1966.  This Hall of Famer and baseball great, went into managing after he retired as a player in 1976.
